div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1954 Cecina, 32 km. SSW of Livorno, (226) Etruria, 1858 Burial: c. 300 B.C.? (K) Contents: 5 AV, 84 AR Massalia: 4 ob. Populonia: 5 "quinarii" (as Sambon 82?) Unc.: obv. wheel (as S. 26) 3 obv. male hd. (as S. 79) Types not specified: 5 AV Disposition: Florence 11; possibly also Jameson 17 and Weber 70 (later SNGLloyd 26), on which see no. 1875 above (Volterra 1868) Gamurrini, PerNumSfrag 1874, p. 68, note 1 Sambon under nos. 26 and 70 says that these types were represented in the Sovana find of 1858. Since both types are mentioned by Gamurrini, Sovana here appears to be a mistake for Cecina
